job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Great Falls, MT
pros: I originally started working there because I enjoyed the manager on the oncology unit. was my first nursing job. When I was hired, we were staffed okay, and my training went well
cons: With covid, we became extremely understaffed. we'd regularly be assigned 7 patients on night shift, and 6-7 on day shift. no regular CNA's because they'd quit so often. the floor was half travel nurses. towards the end, nurses who had less than 5 months of experience were being assigned as charge because they were the only full time nurse assigned. it was difficult to ask for help because we were all drowning. was not a sustainable job.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Great Falls, MT
pros:
Benefis is a great place to work.  There are numerous opportunities for growth within the organization including continuing education and professional growth.

Not only is Benefis a great place to work as an organization, we also have an amazing team of employees throughout the system to work with.  I have never worked for an employer with so many passionate individuals and people who swear that they have the best job in the world.

This passion is not just verbal, it is shown through the number of long-term employees - there are more than 200 people who have worked at Benefis for over 25 years! Some are going on 50 years with the organization!  If that doesn't speak to the being a great place to work, I don't know what does.

Beyond just employment, I love being a part of Benefis for what they do for our community and our region. We all know medical care is expensive. However, Benefis does what it can to keep its costs low and help out every patient who comes through the door, regardless of their ability to pay.  They have staff dedicated to helping patients get their health needs addressed, whether it is checking on if they qualify for medicare or medicaid and helping them enroll, working with them on payment plans, or helping them apply for financial assistance for their medical bills - Benefis cares.
cons: Healthcare is a challenging industry - sometimes making the right choice isn't the most popular choice among staff or the public. I commend senior leadership on always trying to what is truly best for all impacted.

review_title: Work Hard, Play Hard - Grateful in Big Sky Country
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Great Falls, MT
pros: I work among great leaders/mentors.  Qualities of high character, strong work ethic, and respect would describe my team accurately.  Working with high caliber individuals that have well developed perspectives, positive attitudes, and thoughtfulness for those around them, makes coming to work pleasant and I am grateful for that.  I appreciate that work/life balance is important in our team and the level of understanding for this balance is refreshing.  The culture of our office is positive, energetic, supportive, and easy-going.  Our C-suite leader has an undeniable grasp of the modern workplace and contemporary leadership and team building skills.  She maintains a simple expectation: work hard and enjoy life.  It's a privilege to be under her leadership!
cons: Some "veteran" employees have displayed a sense of immunity and superiority over newcomers from time to time which doesn't reflect well on them or the organization.  It establishes an environment of indirect intimidation and is perceived as bullying.  Of which is outdated and unacceptable practice in the modern workplace.

job_title: Phlebotomist in Great Falls, MT
pros: Good benefits, Good career opportunities.
cons: None that I can think of. It’s a great place.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Great Falls, MT
pros:
Education is encouraged/continued/paid for within the hospital.
Tons of opportunity to learn with a variety of clinical cases with different levels of acuity.
The ability to work across different departments for a wealth of nursing knowledge through patient flow/clinical specialist department.
Continued opportunity to work plenty of overtime for both increased monetary gain as well as experience.
Top best 150 places to work in the US.
cons:
Short orientation/preceptorship time before being placed on duty with expectation of existing knowledge with both nursing practice as well as Benefis system SOP's and protocols.
Heavy patient loads with 1 to 2 CNA's for entire floor, RN's provide total care on top of shift duties and medication passes.
Only resource in large geographical area, therefor, many older patients with dementia issues that are non-compliant, at risk for falls, potential for safety concerns without any staff for 1:1's, placing nurses at risk for issues against them for professional/licensure standing.
Not unionized.
Long hours depending on patient loads, staffing, issues during shift.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Great Falls, MT
pros: I absolutely loved working here my team at The Grandview at Benefis was amazing! and very helpful, since i had no Experience as a CNA and this job definitely gave me a lot of experience and knowledge about the medical field and i still have a lot to learn but this was definitely an amazing start for me. I would like to work for Benefis again if i ever came back to Montana. Amazing team, Amazing Patients! and just overall an amazing experience.
cons: Since i had only work for about 9 months and i don't really have a lot of cons to say about Benefis the only thing i would say is that sometimes we were short on staff and I had to be by myself but thats the only thing i would say the con is. It wasn't so bad and RN would help me out so that was really nice. Like i said I think I had a pretty amazing TEAM!

job_title: Supervisor in Great Falls, MT
pros: I have worked at Benefis for 16+ years; within this time, I have worked in 3 different areas of the hospital.  I have enjoyed each area and have progressed into a leadership role with each move. I have had an amazing career and co-workers have become like family to me. The leadership team cares about their employees and values their opinions.  You, as an employee, have many opportunities for growth and are set-up for success starting day 1. In my opinion, I feel Benefis is a phenomenal hospital that continuously keeps updating for the best possible care for patients and employees alike.  Employees are always kept in the "loop" by the CEO as to what is happening through-out the hospital and how this may or may-not affect us in the long term. The benefit packages far exceed what other companies offer.
cons: I cannot speak of any cons as my experience working for Benefis has been a exceptional.

job_title: Rad Tech in Great Falls, MT
pros: I work at Benefis full time and there are many reasons that make it great.  I believe, in my career field, that we get paid higher than any other place in town. I am luck to have the opportunities I have to advance in my area.  We also get the opportunity to work with higher-end equipment.   I appreciate all of the good people that I have met while working here.   I also enjoy all the added perks of random "Thank You' s" we get in the mail!
cons: Sometimes, decisions seem to be made without the people who are affected by those decisions.

review_title: Inner sense of satisfaction with helping others
job_title: Ultrasound Technologist in Great Falls, MT
pros:
The way you feel after you've helped someone - nothing compares
Great benefit package for .5 or higher employment status
Sense of community/family within specific departments
Sense of appreciation for a job well done
cons:
A hospital is open 24/7/365 ...... chances are you are going to work some shifts you don't want to work because the facility is always open.  
Color coded uniforms for individual departments really detract from your sense of individuality.  
It's a big facility - if you aren't familiar with the layout at all - it's a lot to learn just so you don't get lost!!!
You work with people that are at their worst - sometimes it can get very emotionally taxing

review_title: Culture, benefits make Benefis a great place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Great Falls, MT
pros:
Benefis prioritizes its employees whenever possible. They offer a great benefits package, employee-centered events, and good compensation. There is a lot of room for movement in the company, both in your current career path and into other departments. Managers work to keep good staff in the organization.
Great Falls is a lovely city, especially if you like to ski, hike, hunt, or fish.
cons:
Hiring process takes some time
Great Falls is a small city. If you like living in bigger, metropolitan areas you may have a hard time settling in here.

job_title: Financial Analyst in Great Falls, MT
pros: I have been working at Benefis for about two years now and the main reason I love to work at Benefis, is the teamwork with in the Finance Department. The willingness to help each other out is wonderful and not to mention the friendships made along the way! The caring and compassion from our leads is a breath of fresh air. The competitive wages and benefit package is hard to beat.
cons: When there is turnover, the work of the person who left gets given to others leaving them to feel overwhelmed especially at month end.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Great Falls, MT
pros: The staff I work with are usually great and supportive and most days I do have fun. They offer a lot of educational opportunities and do pay you to go. It is not perfect but I have noticed management trying to create a better environment.
cons: The patient to staff ratio in med-surg is not ideal, pretty good in all the other departments. Hourly pay is good/fair but coming in to work extra shifts is not compensated well. No weekend differentials. The experience mix is also a con, a lot of new graduate nurses, less experienced staff.

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Great Falls, MT
